info.title: NetworkManagementClient
info.description: The Microsoft Azure Network management API provides a RESTful set of web services that interact with Microsoft Azure Networks service to manage your network resources. The API has entities that capture the relationship between an end user and the Microsoft Azure Networks service.

delete.description: Deletes the specified authorization from the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

parameters.name: authorizationName
parameters.description: The name of the authorization.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

200.description: Delete successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the specified authorization from the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

parameters.name: authorizationName
parameters.description: The name of the authorization.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates an authorization in the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

parameters.name: authorizationName
parameters.description: The name of the authorization.

parameters.name: authorizationParameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update express route circuit authorization operation.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all authorizations in an express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the circuit.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRouteCircuitAuthorization resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified peering from the specified express route circuit.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

parameters.name: peeringName
parameters.description: The name of the peering.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitPeering resource.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.name: circuitName

parameters.name: peeringParameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update express route circuit peering operation.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitPeering resource.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitPeering resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all peerings in a specified express route circuit.

parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns a list of ExpressRouteCircuitPeering resources.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

delete.description: Deletes the specified Express Route Circuit Connection from the specified express route circuit.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName

parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit connection.

parameters.description: The name of the peering.

parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update express route circuit connection operation.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuitPeering resource.

delete.description: Deletes the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the express route circuit.

202.description: Accepted. Sets 'Disabling' provisioningState until the operation completes. Returns an operation URI that can be queried to find the current state of the operation.

200.description: Delete successful.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets information about the specified express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of express route circuit.

200.description: Request successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates or updates an express route circuit.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: circuitName
parameters.description: The name of the circuit.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters supplied to the create or update express route circuit operation.

201.description: Create successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

patch.description: Updates an express route circuit tags.

200.description: Update successful. The operation returns the resulting ExpressRouteCircuit resource.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the currently advertised ARP table associated with the express route circuit in a resource group.

202.description: Accepted and the operation will complete asynchronously.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Gets the currently advertised routes table summary associated with the express route circuit in a resource group.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets all the available express route service providers.
